XWaves Help:
XWaves is our premier ocean surface wavefield analysis toolbox for MATLABTM. Import wave spectral data from most popular sources to conduct scientific investigations, metocean design studies, and sea state analyses. Generate scientific and engineering design products, web-ready graphics, animation files, and custom data tables.

 

Easy to Use

Convenient Graphical User Interface (GUI) for all functions.  Directly load wind and spectral wave data obtained from a variety of instruments, models and archives including:

• RTI, Nortek, Datawell, WaMoS, Triaxys, and Wavescan

• WaveWatch III, SWAN, and Oceanweather

• NODC and NDBC (Automated download!)

• NetCDF formatted files

 

Included are tools to set up an automated sequence for real-time data collection and web display of results.

 

Wind Sea and Swell Partitioning

Separate and track wind sea and swell wave systems with a proven wave spectrum partitioning technology (Hanson and Phillips, J. Atms. Oceanic Technol, 2001).

Included are three different windsea identification approaches and an optional temporal trend adjustment for removing noise.

Estimate and map swell source times, locations, and routes.

 

Versatile Data Exploration

Explore your results with our custom Data View interface.  Create multi-plot displays from extensive plot libraries:

• Wave spectra and bulk statistics

• Wave systems (wind sea and swell features)

• Spectral fits

• Swell source maps (Great-circle routes)

• Climatology

• Sea State (Joint probability, scatter tables, etc.)

• Data comparisons (Over-plot and compare data sets)

 

Export presentation quality graphics, data animations, and custom data tables in most common formats.

 

Engineering Design Tools

Generate spectral fits to your wave components including JONSWAP, Lognormal, Gaussian, and a Cos2n directional distribution.  Export sea state history files, joint probability tables, scatter tables, and wind sea and swell histograms.

 

Additional Information

XWaves requires MATLABTM to operate, or we can develop a custom executable for your application.  Windows, Linux and Macintosh platforms are supported.  See other WaveForce products at www.WaveForceTechnologies.com.

 

For product sales contact info@WaveForceTechnologies.com.

Program Installation:
IMPORTANT:    NEW  USERS  MUST  READ  AND  AGREE  TO  THE  LICENSE AGREEMENT  THAT  APPEARS  DURING  INSTALLATION.    INSTALLING  THE SOFTWARE  IMPLIES  THAT  YOU  AGREE  TO  ALL  STATED  TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

 

XWaves is designed to run in the MS Windows, Macintosh and Linux O/S environments. To  optimize  menu  legibility  Windows  XP  users  should  switch  control  panel  display settings to “classic view”.

 

To install from a CD follow these simple steps:

1. Decide where to install XWaves on your computer hard disk.  The program will operate from any location that you have read/
    write access to.

2. Drag or copy the XWaves folder from CD-ROM to the selected location on your PC hard disk

3. Ensure that the XWaves folders, and all subfolders, are not write-protected by right-clicking on the XWaves folder and selecting
    Properties.  The Read Only box should not be checked, and this condition should be applied to all subfolders and files.

4. Start MATLAB, and change the MATLAB Current Folder to the XWaves folder.  This step only needs to be done the first time
    you run XWaves.

5. Type xwaves at the command prompt and follow the installation instructions.

 

For reading and saving data, XWaves provides the ability to browse to any folder of choice.  See Data Formats for an overview of XWaves data structures.
